title: Survival Cantonese for International Students
description: A non-credit-bearing basic Cantonese course offering to CUHK international students, including exchange students, full-time undergraduate and postgraduate students, who use Chinese as a second/foreign language and are looking for survival skills in Cantonese. The course is structured to help students communicate orally with people in Cantonese in different scenarios, with student-centred, proficiency-orientated activities based on useful daily expressions and basic vocabulary items. This course focuses on students' listening and speaking skills. Real-life settings are introduced, such as shopping, introduction of oneself, asking for directions, etc.
outcome: Students are expected to:(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily conversations with appropriate usage學生於完成本科時預期能：（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求(S&L2) 將所學句式和詞彙組成簡短對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
syllabus: Learning topics include:-Introduction to Cantonese sounds and tones and basic Cantonese particles. Common loan words in Cantonese-Basic greeting expressions and classroom expressions-Common dishes in Hong Kong-Simple useful expressions for telephone conversation, taxis and minibuses-Places of interests in Hong Kong-Sports and pastime-Clothes and basic necessity-Names of major buildings in CUHK and campus facilities (dormitories, supermarket, clinic and canteen, etc.)內容包括：-粵語語音及拼寫法、常見外來語-問候、課室用語-常見香港菜餚-電話對話、乘搭的士及小巴的通用語-香港名勝-運動及娛樂-衣履及日常用品-中大主要大樓名稱及校園設施（宿舍、超市、保健處、飯堂等等）
required_readings: Textbook chapters and supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

title: Introduction to Chinese Characters
description: An elementary course to introduce basic Chinese characters with real life examples in Hong Kong. This course will introduce the formation of Chinese characters and stroke orders. It will also discuss the use of traditional and simplified Chinese characters to arouse students’ interest and awareness of the usage of Chinese characters in different cities in the Greater Bay Area.

Read individual words and short phrases in real life contexts;4. Notice the use of traditional Chinese characters and simplified Chinese characters in the Greater Bay Area.完成本科目後，學生將能夠：1. 了解漢字的歷史和演變;2. 了解漢字的構造;3. 閱讀現實生活中的單詞和短語;4. 注意大灣區使用繁體字和簡體字的情況。

title: Sounds of Cantonese
description: This course introduces the phonetic system of Cantonese to CUHK international students. Supported by audiovisual aids, students will understand the sound of the vowels and consonants, the pronunciation rules, and the intonations in casual conversations and in reading literature. The articulation of some Cantonese sounds that needs attention for second language learners will also be examined. Through interactive classroom learning activities, students' accuracy of Cantonese pronunciation will be enhanced.
outcome: Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:1. Produce Cantonese sounds accurately;2. Identify phonetic rules and apply them to pronunciation properly;3. Reduce pronunciation errors;4. Identify meaning-change through tones;5. Speak accurately and fluently.完成本科目後，學生將能夠：1. 準確地發出廣東話聲音；2. 識別語音規則並將其應用到説話中；3. 減少發音錯誤；4. 通過不同聲調識別意義變化；5. 說話準確流利。
syllabus: 1. Structure of a Cantonese syllable: initial and final2. Consonants: word initials and word final consonants3. Stops, fricatives, affricates, nasals and laterals4. Aspiration5. Vowels: single vowels and vowel glides6. Tones7. Tones in phrases8. Speaking in context

title: Cantonese through Songs
requirements: For students who have taken CLCC1703,CCAN1703,2013 or above. For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLC
description: This is an integrated theme-based course designed for students who want to improve their Cantonese listening and speaking skills through the appreciation of Cantonese songs. This course focuses on the analysis of linguistic and cultural aspects of Cantonese songs. Coursework will include listening and reading exercises, class discussions of selected Cantonese songs with their peers, and a series of short talks prepared by students on an aspect of Cantonese songs. Emphasis will be also placed on the training of accurate Cantonese pronunciation through the reading of lyrics. The course will increase students’ cultural awareness, vocabulary and communicative competence in Cantonese.
outcome: Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:1. Engage and participate in oral discussion on cultural topics;2. Gain the cultural knowledge and vocabulary on Cantonese culture;3. Improve accuracy in Cantonese pronunciation;4. Improve the ability to understand Cantonese and to reuse them.完成本科目後，學生將能夠：1. 參與文化話題的口頭討論；2. 掌握廣東文化知識和詞彙；3. 提高廣東話發音的準確性；4. 提高理解廣東話和重複使用廣東話的能力。
syllabus: 1. Some facts about Cantonese songs2. Genres of Cantonese songs3. Vocabulary related to songs4. Selected Cantonese songs and lyrics5. The relationship between Cantonese songs and culture

description: A non-credit-bearing Cantonese course designed for Mandarin-speaking undergraduate students, postgraduate students, tutors or research assistants. The course is structured to help students learn relevant expressions and apply them in their tutorial lessons or at work. Training includes: (1) effective utilisation of basic Cantonese in communicating with local students during tutorials and (2) proper use of academic Cantonese to make simple descriptions and presentations of one's thesis to their academic advisors or colleagues. Students will acquire relevant vocabulary in professional settings. This course helps students adjust to University and work life in Hong Kong. Furthermore, the course can improve students' Cantonese speaking ability in the tutorial classes they are hosting.

title: Advanced Cantonese for Chinese Speakers
requirements:
1. For students who have taken CLCC2703 or CCAN2703 (3013). 
2. Not for students who have taken CCAN4013.
3. For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLC.
description: An advanced course for students who have completed CLCC2703, CCAN2703 or CCAN3013. For students who have not completed any of the above courses, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLC.This course equips students with various advanced communicative skills in various academic and professional settings, such as seminars, meetings, group discussions, debates, presentations, performances, impromptu speaking, etc. Students are trained to speak in connected discourse in academic and professional settings with different levels of formality.
outcome: Students are expected to:(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations(S&L5) present ideas at the discourse level in real-life professional settings(R3) read and understand authentic articles related to daily life, culture, or society targeted at native Chinese speakers學生於完成本科時預期能：（學習成果：第四級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中交際的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略，能完成學習或工作中常見的任務(S&L5) 將所學句式和詞彙適當地運用於不同的語境之中發表意見(R3) 讀懂以中文母語者為目標讀者的與日常生活、文化或社會話題相關的文章
syllabus: 1. 關注年青一代  2. 計劃多彩假期  3. 漫談本地娛圈  4. 參與體育活動  5. 討論香港政策  6 . 分享投資心得  7. 細說香港樓市  8. 暢談科技世界  9. 招聘理想人才  10. 探討道德價值

title: Reading in Context III
description: An advanced course to introduce the use of Chinese characters with real life examples and contextualized exercises in a wide variety of settings. It will focus on recognition of Chinese characters and readings at discourse level.

title: Communication in Professional Settings
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) and CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course designed to help students communicate with extended vocabulary in advanced settings through real-life language tasks/activities and contextualised exercises. Topics include social issues in Hong Kong, environmental issues, Chinese customs and religion, etc.
outcome: Students are expected to:(PO2: for levels 2-3) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to convey meaning, and satisfy personal needs and social demands(S&L1) understand and reply to short connected utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in most real-life conversations學生於完成本科時預期能：（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝通、滿足基本的交際需要(S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙和句式，能聽懂大部分日常生活中簡短的成段對話並作出回應
syllabus: This course provides vocabulary and speaking practice with language scenarios in relation to the topics below:  1. Hiring a helper  2. A day in the office  3. Entertainment and sports  4. Dinner at the teacher’s home  5. At a wedding party  6. At the airport  7. An evening get-together in Cantonese  8. Seeing a film together  9. Discussing travel plans  10. Talking about hobbies

title: Colloquial Cantonese and Local Culture
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course designed to improve students' fluency in real-life communication settings through various language activities and discussions. Topics for discussion include comparative studies between formal and informal discourses, Cantonese colloquialisms and culture.
outcome: Students are expected to:(PO2: for levels 2-3) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to convey meaning, and satisfy personal needs and social demands(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life conversations with appropriate usage學生於完成本科時預期能：（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝通、滿足基本的交際需要(S&L2) 運用所學詞彙和句式完成簡短的成段對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
syllabus: This course provides vocabulary and speaking practice with language scenarios in relation to informal speaking styles.  1. Cantonese colloquialism  2. Informal conversations

title: Communication in Context IV – Cantonese
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC2223(CCAN2223), CLCC2233(CCAN2233) or CLCC2243(CCAN2243)
description: An advanced course designed to help students communicate with extended vocabulary in formal settings through real-life language tasks/activities and contextualised exercises.

title: Special Topics I
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course focused on building up students’ listening ability in advanced context and presenting students with multi-media authentic materials. Topics for discussion include social issues in Hong Kong, environmental issues, Chinese custom and religion etc.

title: Advanced Reading and Speaking
description: An advanced course to introduce the use of Chinese characters with authentic materials and contextualized exercises in professional settings. Readings will be based on materials such as prose, argumentative essays, descriptive essays, drama scripts, etc.

title: Discussion Topics on Hong Kong Issues
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course designed to build up the students’ confidence in using a variety of vocabulary in formal settings through specific topics and contextualized exercises. Topics include various local news and issues related to our society, such as education system, economy and immigration.

syllabus: This course equips students with various advanced communicative skills in various academic and professional settings, such as meetings, group discussions, presentations, and impromptu speaking. Students are trained to speak in connected discourse in academic and professional settings with different levels of formality.This course provides vocabulary and speaking practice with language scenarios in relation to the topics below: 1. Family life 2. Personal pursuits 3. Hong Kong education system 4. Understanding the SAR 5. New immigrants in Hong Kong

title: Discussion Topics on China Issues
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course designed to further improve students' fluency in professional communication settings through language activities, role-playing and discussion practice. Topics for discussion include various China news and issues related to Chinese society, such as the education system, the economy and immigration.

title: Communication in Context V – Cantonese
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course designed to train students’ presentation and negotiation ability in professional settings. Topics for discussion include various local & international news and issues related to our society, such as education system, economy and immigration.

title: Listening Comprehension Skills in Professional Settings
description: An advanced course focused on building up students' listening ability in professional context and presenting students with multi-media authentic materials. Topics for discussion include various local and international news and issues related to our society, such as education system,economy and immigration.

title: Newspaper Reading
description: An advanced course designed to improve students' language ability through the reading and discussion of selections from newspapers in standard written Chinese. Topics include international relations, political news, crime, economic news, accidents, etc.

title: Special Topics II
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: Courses designed for different kinds of working professionals, such as businesspersons, bankers, financial consultants, education specialists, religious and social workers, etc. Sector specific trainings are designed to cater for advanced students’ needs. e.g. the Cantonese for religious workers course provides training on Bible reading, Sunday liturgy and Mass liturgy.

title: Pragmatic Internship in China (PRINCH, Advanced Level)
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: PRINCH is a task-based course designed to provide advanced level students with the opportunity to use language in real life for real communication purposes. It allows students to practice what they have learned in class through a variety of activities in the target culture, focusing on topics related to social, political and economic issue. Class format consists of three parts: 1) Pre-trip activities with teachers; 2) Theme-based trip in small groups led by teachers or teaching assistants; and 3) Post-trip tasks with teachers, such as Q&A, discussion and presentation.
